snippet: In Detroit, young fashion designers are focusing their talents to benefit many of the more than 20,000 homeless people now living on the streets.
abstract: Young fashion designers in Detroit, through nonprofit company Empowerment Plan, are focusing their talents on designing clothes that will benefit the city's homeless, as well as employing some of them to make items like coat that can double as a sleeping bag.
lead_paragraph: In Detroit, young fashion designers are focusing their talents to benefit many of the more than 20,000 homeless people now living on the streets.

headline.seo: Young Designers Focus Efforts on Homeless Population in Detroit
headline.main: Altering Clothes, and Lives, With Design
headline.print_headline: Altering Clothes, and Lives, With Design
